name: DATASETS
content:
Collections Agent - Datasets Overview


This section provides a detailed description of the datasets powering the Collections Agent system. These datasets encompass structured financial records, customer information, payment history, and unstructured customer communications. Together, they enable:

  • Intelligent invoice classification
  • Accurate payment prediction
  • Nuanced sentiment analysis


Input Datasets


Invoices Dataset

Contains detailed records of invoices issued to customers. It serves as the core financial dataset for tracking unpaid invoices and analyzing invoice aging and payment status.

Key Fields:

  • Invoice Number – Unique identifier for the invoice
  • Customer ID – Unique identifier for the customer
  • Invoice Amount – Total billed amount
  • Invoice Date – Date when the invoice was issued
  • Due Date – Date payment is due
  • Invoice Status – (Paid, Open, Overdue)


Customers Dataset

Contains master profiles of customers with demographics and segmentation details. Supports customer profiling and segmentation for targeted analysis.

Key Fields:

  • Customer ID – Unique identifier for the customer
  • Customer Name – Full name of the customer
  • Country, State, City – Location details
  • Customer Segment – (Retail, SME, Corporate)


Collection Tickets Dataset

Tracks collection-related tickets raised for invoices. Helps monitor collections workflow and issue resolution.

Key Fields:

  • Collection ID – Unique identifier for the collection case
  • Customer ID – Reference to the customer
  • Invoice ID – Reference to the related invoice
  • Created Date – Date the ticket was created
  • Ticket Status – (Open, Resolved, Escalated)
  • Escalation Flag – Indicates whether escalation occurred


Emails Dataset

Comprises unstructured customer communications (emails) related to invoices. Essential for sentiment analysis and dispute detection.

Key Fields:

  • Email ID – Unique identifier for the email
  • Collection Ticket ID – Reference to the related collection ticket
  • Invoice ID – Reference to the related invoice
  • Email Subject – Subject line of the email
  • Body Text – Full email text
  • Timestamp – Date and time of the email


Final Output Dataset


The Final Output Dataset consolidates invoice records, customer details, communication insights, and ML-driven predictive scores. It enables collection teams to target the right accounts first and optimize recovery strategies.


Key Fields:

  • Invoice Number (invoice_no) – Unique identifier for the invoice
  • Customer ID (customer_id) – Unique identifier for the customer
  • Invoice Date (invoice_date) – Date the invoice was issued
  • Invoice Amount (invoice_amount) – Total billed amount
  • Customer Segment (customer_segment) – Retail / SME / Enterprise
  • Email Text (email_text) – Extracted communication from the customer
  • Sentiment Score (sentiment_score) – Numeric sentiment value (negative = dispute, positive = cooperative)
  • Predicted Payment Likelihood (pred_payment_likelihood) – Probability of on-time payment
  • Predicted Recovery Amount (pred_recovery_amount) – Expected recovery (predicted value)
  • Predicted Escalation Score (pred_escalation_score) – Likelihood/urgency of escalation
  • Escalation Flag (escalated) – Yes / No indicator of escalation
  • Customer Payment Within Time Limit (customer_pay_within_time_limit) – Yes / No indicator of likely timely payment
  • Priority Value (priority_value) – Composite score for prioritization
  • Rank (rank) – Final rank for follow-up (1 = highest priority)
  • Collection Case ID (collection_id) – Unique identifier for the collection case


Summary

  • Input Datasets → Provide raw financial, customer, workflow, and communication data.
  • Final Output Dataset → Enriches raw data with ML predictions, sentiment insights, and prioritization metrics.


Together, these datasets allow finance and collections teams to:

  • Prioritize accounts effectively
  • Identify risks early
  • Improve recovery outcomes
  • Enhance overall cash flow efficiency
